body.p:
Prestonsburg Ky
Feb 22d 1861
To His Excellancy
Beriah Magoffin
Governor of Ky

Your Petitioner Wm Owsley represents that he was tried before Jas T. Ford Esqr on a Charge of Adultery and was fined by sd Court $20, and cost without the intervention of a Jury -- : He says that some 85 years since in the state of virginia he had a wife who gave him an infectious disease towit the clap and he then left her and has not lived with or cohabitated with her since he says he the court swore your Petitioner and he refused to answer any thing; but the he says however his marriage was never proved and his refusal to answer was taken as conclusive against him as he is advised and believes he says he was not bound to answer as he believes; He says his marriage not being proved, nor his guilt proved and he being refused a trial by a Jury; all induces him to believe he was unlawfully fined he therefore asks your Excellency to remit the same and as in duty will ever pray
Wm Owsley says the statements in the foregoing petition are true
Sworn to before me by Wm Owsley this 22d Feb 1861

E Trimble O C D C
for James Trimble Clk
We the underassigned persens Join in the prayer of the petitioner Wm Owsley and believe him a truthful and an honest man and hope you can find it consistent with your duty to remit the same

Edwin Trimble
John M Burns
Robert H. Wedington
John M, Elliott
S. J. Vaughan
E H Harris
James Trimble Clk
John Friend
Ed. J. Friend
M. S. Reynolds
